channel.title: Comments on: Dinosaur farts and global warming – a crude analysis

item.title: By: Taylor Reints
item.dc:creator: Taylor Reints
item.description:
I have found something in complete contradiction of this. From the Triassic period until the Cretaceous, the oxygen in the atmosphere increased.
Triassic = 16% (80% of modern level) Jurassic = 26% (130% of modern level) Cretaceous = 30% (150% of modern level) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Sauerstoffgehalt-1000mj.svg
item.content:encoded:
I have found something in complete contradiction of this. From the Triassic period until the Cretaceous, the oxygen in the atmosphere increased.

Triassic = 16% (80% of modern level)
Jurassic = 26% (130% of modern level)
Cretaceous = 30% (150% of modern level)
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Sauerstoffgehalt-1000mj.svg

item.title: By: Media Blows Hot Air About Dinosaur Flatulence | Dinosaur Tracking

item.description: [...] our ability to investigate dinosaur farts is severely limited. Furthermore, paleo-blogger Jon Tennant names a number of other problems with the back-of-the-envelope calculations at the heart of the [...]
item.content:encoded: […] our ability to investigate dinosaur farts is severely limited. Furthermore, paleo-blogger Jon Tennant names a number of other problems with the back-of-the-envelope calculations at the heart of the […]

item.title: By: Roy-Z (@rolewiii)
item.dc:creator: Roy-Z (@rolewiii)
item.description: ...you're completely right. I took a look at this, and as a Paleoclimatologist, I was baffled at these assumptions. It didn't work for the Pleistocene, in which we have plentiful proxies, so why should one be convinced by a purely (flawed) mathematical modeling approach? Just a bunch of arm-waving, here.
item.content:encoded: …you’re completely right. I took a look at this, and as a Paleoclimatologist, I was baffled at these assumptions. It didn’t work for the Pleistocene, in which we have plentiful proxies, so why should one be convinced by a purely (flawed) mathematical modeling approach? Just a bunch of arm-waving, here.

item.title: By: Oliver Knevitt
item.dc:creator: Oliver Knevitt
item.description:
Wow, that is one serious bitchslapping, Jon!
I agree; this is literally a back of the envelope calculation that would be more at home if it was featured as a fun side thing, like in the New Scientist's last word column or something. Utterly pointless trying to put a concrete figure on something that nebulous, with so many variables and things we don't know.
item.content:encoded:
Wow, that is one serious bitchslapping, Jon!

I agree; this is literally a back of the envelope calculation that would be more at home if it was featured as a fun side thing, like in the New Scientist’s last word column or something. Utterly pointless trying to put a concrete figure on something that nebulous, with so many variables and things we don’t know.
